A toddler battling a rare form of kidney cancer hopes to raise cash for the hospital ward where she has received her treatment. 
Three-year-old Talya Toubkin is one of just a handful of people diagnosed with a Wilms tumour, which affects around 80 children in the UK every year. 
The tot, from Withington , is being supported by family friend Lisa Headley who plans to chop her long hair and donate it to the Princess Trust in Talya’s name. 
She also hopes to raise money for the Ward 84 at the Royal Manchester Children’s Hospital where Talya has received her treatment. 
Lisa, who has been growing her hair so it can be used for a long wig, said she was inspired to help her friends after hearing about their struggle. Talya with family friend Lisa Headley Read More Family of 5-year-old who died after being crippled by arthritis say it took 20 hospital visits to diagnose him 
She said: “When I found out about Talya I just couldn’t imagine what they were all going through and what it would be like if we were going through that with our son and I just wanted to do something to help.” 
Talya’s mum Nicola, 36, has described the moment she found out her daughter was ill. 
She said: “Talya had been complaining of tummy ache on and off but was generally well in herself. 
“I booked a doctor’s appointment but three days before I noticed a big lump on her tummy. It was the morning of September 2 and I will never forget it. I went to the GP and we were sent straight to A&E where she was given a scan and started treatment. 
“When you hear your child has cancer you feel like your whole world has fallen apart.” 
Talya underwent a course of radiotherapy at The Christie just before Christmas. 
She must now have a weekly chemotherapy session every Monday for the next four months. Mum Nicola Toubkin with Talya and Lisa Read More Mum diagnosed with terminal cancer - after she is picked at random for screening trial 
Web master Nicola, who also has a six-month-old son, Ari, said the treatment has taken its toll on the children and her husband Daniel. 
She added: “We have just been telling her she has a poorly tummy because it’s so difficult for a three-year-old to be prodded and poked and have so many tests. It was horrific..” 
Nicola, who first met Lisa when both women were pregnant, said she is very grateful to her friend for supporting the family. She said: “Lisa was thinking about donating her hair so when she found out about Talya she thought she could also help to raise money for the ward where she has been treated. It’s so kind. It’s an incredible ward. They’re like a family, everyone is so kind.” 
To support Talya and Lisa visit: www.justgiving.com/fundraising/Lisa-Headley1 Like us on Facebook
